column1: Nowy Tomyśl [ˈnɔvɨ ˈtɔmɨɕl] (German: Neutomischel) is a town in western Poland
column2: in Greater Poland Voivodeship.  It is the capital of Nowy Tomyśl County.  The population is 15

column1: The town has a long tradition of wickerwork. In the main town square stands a wicker basket woven in 2006
column4: entered in the Guinness Book of Records as the world's largest basket. The town also has a Museum of Basketry and Hop Growing
column5: which is one of the branches of the National Museum of Agriculture in Szreniawa. Next to the museum is a small zoo.

column2: Nowy Tomyśl has been the site of one of the tallest wind turbines in the world.
